intro: Tetratome cinerea, commonly known as the gray tetratome, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pale green leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale in color, with five petals and a distinctive corona. Tetratome cinerea is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
